title: Scaling Self-Supervised Representation Learning for Symbolic Piano Performance
author: Louis Bradshaw (Queen Mary University of London), Honglu Fan (University of Geneva), Alexander Spangher (University of Southern California), Stella Biderman (EleutherAI), Simon Colton (Queen Mary University of London), ...
relevance_why: The self-supervised learning techniques discussed could be applied to improve audio generation and music modeling, which is relevant to Haohe Liu's research interests in audio processing.
background: This paper investigates generative modeling and representation learning for symbolic music through self-supervised learning techniques, particularly focusing on piano performances.
contribution: This paper introduces a large-scale autoregressive transformer model called Aria, trained on symbolic piano music to enhance generative modeling and representation learning in music, achieving state-of-the-art results in both tasks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods focused on smaller datasets and had limited generalizability across different music tasks.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by utilizing a significantly larger dataset (approximately 100k hours of music) and applying self-supervised learning to enhance both generation and classification capabilities.

key_innovation: The method leverages a large-scale dataset for training, which enables effective modeling of long-term dependencies and performance attributes in music.
real_world_impact: The advancements in symbolic music modeling have the potential to improve automated music generation tools, benefiting composers and enhancing creative processes in music production.
limitations: The paper does not address challenges related to incorporating richer metadata in transcriptions that could enhance the generated outputs.

new_terms.autoregressive model: **Autoregressive model** is a type of model that predicts future values based on past observed values, applied here in the context of music generation.
new_terms.self-supervised learning: **Self-supervised learning** is a form of unsupervised learning where the model learns from unlabeled data by predicting part of the input from other parts.

open_sourcing: The code and model are available at: https://github.com/eleutherai/aria
